instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: 3332 chimes and immediately restarts
threads.message:
Originally this board came in with what I believed to be <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> issue but I think was malfunctioning GPU regardless as resoldering with lead solder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> multiple times. Something happened while working on board that caused PPBUS G3H to drop to 1.4V. I discovered that appeared to be a short but was issue with <CHIP>U8930</CHIP> that mustve been shorting PPVIN <SIGNAL>S5_HS_GPU</SIGNAL> to GFXIMVP phase line.

I tried bypassing the GPU thinking this would solve the board not booting but no change.

threads.title: 3332 chimes and immediately restarts
threads.message: Try removing <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>, se if board stays on at least.
